description: From play +‎ -ock. Cognate with Scots playok (“toy”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete, UK dialectal) A plaything; a toy.
examples: […]  I would therefore like if you will lend her a note, and ye may put half-a-crown in the hand of each of the poor weans for a playock, — for she's a proud spirit, and will bear much before she complain.
